definition: to offer a libation/person who performs the libation before a banquet/senior member of a profession/important government post in imperial China
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: After worshiping the ancestors (on one day), he gave a jug of libation to the servants who helped him.
sentences.chinese: 祭过祖宗以后，他把一壶祭酒赏给帮忙的仆人。

sentences.english: Jacob set up a stone pillar at the place where God had talked with him, and he poured out a drink offering on it; he also poured oil on it.
sentences.chinese: 雅各便在那里立了一根石柱，在柱子上祭酒，浇油。

definition: official registrar (of a county etc) in imperial China
same as 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] Book of History
senior provincial official in imperial China
Director of the Imperial Clan in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
(army) commander-in-chief (archaic)/provincial military governor and civil administrator during the early Republic of China era (1911-1949 AD)
Imperial College of Supreme Learning, established in 124 BC, and the highest educational institute in ancient China until the Sui Dynasty
the most senior minister of many kingdoms or dynasties (with varying roles)/prime minister
